content: Need help. I have a Samsung Galaxy S10 and it has a built-in HRM. It was working fine and I took two measurements for two days. Now the Galaxy option is missing and it's using the camera. The main reason why I bought the app was because of the support for Galaxy Samsung S10 heart rate monitor. How do I reactivate the settings for Galaxy when the option is missing when it was there previously?

This is a fantastic app. I am using it on a Samsung S7 phone, which has a builtin heart rate (HR) detector (IR), so I dont have to use the flash. So I may be biased on its ease of use in collecting data (no burnt fingertips that is). First and foremost, this app seems to be the only one that provides heart rate variability (HRV) off the bat for a generic phone (as others whom I recommended it to have found). Many kudos to the developer for providing such an essential tool for a low price.
The app works very well as well as the sync with training peaks and all the data I get from it is very interesting
Keeps crashing on Samsung S21. Worked flawlessly on its, so I was disappointed it didn't work the same on Android
This app is much better and accurate than most others I tried.

The data is priceless but the app for android is often buggy and does not sync information from my oura ring. I followed the troubleshooting tips and still have the same problem frequently throughout the week when trying to sync my hrv data. After repeating the steps of setting the sync from oura and enabling the feature, the app will often try to measure hrv using the phone camera as well.
Well, I am no expert with an HRV but I can recognize awesome customer care and support. That alone would be enough for me to go with these people!
Does a good job on HRV as advertised. Have been using it for the last year or so. The developers have been very responsive to a question and request. Highly recommended. Thanks Marco
Game changing recovery tool!

This worked well for awhile, but I quit using it last fall when I was injured. Now it won't register after 4 plus days of input over and over as well as Uninstaller reinstalling. Thinking of whoop or oura. Frustrating.
replyContent: hi there, apologies for the issues. Would you mind reaching us at hello@HRV4Training.com, then we can try to help you. Thank you

content: To have a peer-reviewed HRV measuring device at the convenience of your smartphone is impressive. Aside from the ease of use and convenient tracking of HRV, the app provides a daily practical training guide, knowing when to push or hold back. With consistent use, I was able to improve fitness and beat existing personal bests without compromising recovery.
1 because it does not even show the proper heart rate with the camera of Samsung. It shows 30-40 bpm. I tried other apps and many of them show heart rate correctly with the same method.
replyContent: hi Olga, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. If you can reach out to us via email, we will try to help you out to obtain optimal signal quality with the app. Please write at hello@HRV4Training.com - thank you

content: App spettacolare, molto utile sopratutto per sportive che piace monitorare ogni dettaglio. Super consigliata
I frequently can't get the app to even start up. I'm on a pixel 3 XL.
replyContent: hi Alex, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. Would you mind reaching us at hello@HRV4Training.com? We should be able to help in this case, thank you

content: Overall, so far so good. The Strava integration doesn't work if you sign in to Strava with Google single sign on.

Haven't found this app useful unfortunately. It rarely accurately reflects my body state after intense workouts, or recovery days... But, at least the camera scanner worked quickly & easily - so, I blundered on with it. Now, the camera scanner doesn't work (after last update, I think) same story when connected to my hr chest strap, always reports a bad reading... The hr strap is 100% reliable when hooked up to my Garmin. I give up. Not worth the bother.
replyContent: hi Marc, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the issues experienced. Please feel free to reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com and we'll help you out. Unfortunately not all straps provide accurate beat to beat data, despite working well for average heart rate during exercise. Thanks!

content: Won't open past first boot logo.
replyContent: hi Joseph, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. Would you mind reaching us at hello@HRV4Training.com? We should be able to help in this case, thank you

content: If you want to improve as an athlete, this is one of the best apps around.

I think some debug messaging was left in the app for this update. Tons of "baby's first notifications" when connecting and measuring to Polar H10 each morning. "newState" "connecting to GATT server" etc.

Initially the App seemed to be okay.As a check would take readings continuos 4 times errors of upto .6 for HRV. Of late since last 2 days my pulse shows 35 to 40 means i am dying at the same time pulse should be 70. Also signals never show optimized. My placement of fingur is exactly same way. Money down the drain.
Very difficult to get a good or optimal reading

Have used it on and off since it's very early days. Works like it says it should and I find it helps me validate each training or rest day. I don't use it as the only measure of whether to train but I find it quite accurate and helpful. Great app and the camera sensor is such a simple time saver in the morning. Highly recommend.
I have Samsung S20, can you please get the application to not use the light when measuring?

Imported a couple of weeks of data from oura ring and the first day it synced with oura for daily reading. Then after 2nd day it stopped reading from oura ring. And on day four of using the app it lost the daily data from three days ago. Takes a long time to read history despite being only a couple of weeks' data in there. I bought for its compatibility with oura ring which it no longer does, so basically a wasted purchase.
replyContent: hi there! You can always re-read previous days from the History page, tap a measurement bar or missing measurement bar and then "read from Oura". If data does not show up right away this is because Oura did not sync with Cloud, you can force it from their app from Menu / Backup data. Feel free to reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com, thanks!

content: Dopo un utilizzo di circa 2 mesi ritengo questa app un'ottima app, registro che rispecchia nella realtà di ogni giorno il mio stato psico-fisico, ancora poco tempo e saprò interpretare ancora meglio tutti i dati grazie anche all'ottima guida in linea. Ho un Moto G 6 e funziona benissimo. Cortesi e veloci le risposte su alcune delucidazione avvenuti tramite e-mail. Chi vuole uno strumento per poter interpretare le proprie reazioni ed adeguamenti del proprio corpo all'attività fisica e no con HRV4Training lo ha trovato.

Every time I go to use this app and measure my heart rate to use it it says not good and I have to do it again. That and the light burns my fingertip. About 4 or 5 tries later it takes a reading. Any other app gets my heart rate no problem

Designed for iPhones where the flash is right next to the camera - this app is a complete waste of money if you're using a different phone because the measurements won't work and it's incredibly fussy about which devices it will pair with should you try to work around this fundamental design flaw.

My issue with this app is the shear amount of technical jargon, yes the pretty graphs look great but they don't help me make workout choices due to my lack of understanding... Surely a less complex cleaner UI would benefit most users.
replyContent: hi there! Please feel free to reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com and we'll try to support you in making use of the collected data. Thank you

content: All in one hrv tracker for a fantastic price

I understand the benefits behind using this technology, however I have a fundamental problem measuring my HRV w this app. I am using a Samsung Galaxy S10e and when taking a HRV measurement it really burns my finger tip. I reduced the settings down to the lowest measurement time (45s), but it's still very uncomfortable. During the measurement I can actually feel my blood pressure increasing in response to the pain in my burning finger, so I'm unsure if the accuracy of measurement is affected.
Love this app, not been using it long yet but already I'm seeing how my daily exersize is effecting my sleep and injury risk. Very effective app. I'd love to see a caffeine correlation too.

Worked fine on my old phone but I am unable to get a reading on my new one, the flash seems to be too far away from the main camera. Not the fault of the developer but after paying £10 for this app I'd like to still be able to use it
A great app for daily use which gives really useful insights. It would be useful to have sliders for tagging volume, intensity and density as an alternative to using RPE / TSS.
Helped a lot in the short period of time to know more about the stress levels
Can't see any of my historical data, the screen just says measurements hidden. Not an intuitive app
replyContent:
hi Stephanie, please from Menu / Settings make sure that "show daily advice" is checked, and you'll see all your data. Thank  you and take care

Marco

content: The support was helpful and they replied to my question quickly.

Haven't had a problem with readings as others have, you just need to keep your finger still which isn't that difficult. What's missing is comments / info on what all the individual measures mean and what is good and why.. e.g. is a lower reading better than a higher one. Also why does the main screen show a number between 1-10 but the history doesn't show this, only the individual measures. Also the colouring bar on the home screen was a little confusing. It's a good app, needs polish.
replyContent: hi James, in general, a higher score means that your body is more rested, even though you will see when using the app, that ideally your scores should be within your normal values (the app will detect this for you and report it color coded in green). Feel free to reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com, limited space here but happy to help!

content: Really helped me with structuring my training. Customer service is five star, too. Highly recommended!

Really wanted this to work, was looking forward to using in every day life. But every reading comes back as poor quality. Must have tried well over 50 times, following the advice given, despite my android dual camera phone apparently being compatible. Unfortunately also looks like I gave it too long a trial as now can't get refund either.
replyContent: hi Chris, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the  trouble. Please reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com - we can first try to help you out, and of course also give you a refund in case you cannot make use of the app, no worries. take care

content: I spent 30 minutes trying to get an optimal reading on the second day, practically burning my finger on the flash. This is not worth the trouble, or the $10.
replyContent: hi Jon, , thank you for your message and really sorry to hear about the  trouble. Please reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com and we an try to provide some useful tips to make sure you can measure using the camera, or give you a refund in case you cannot make use of the app, no worries.

content: Not happy. Almost every reading says the result is not optimal, even when I take the phone cover off. Frustrating!

Not sure what's changed but a few days after leaving my previous review on April 20th, HRV4training started working again. It's continued to work for the past couple weeks so I'm bumping my rating back up.
replyContent: hi Bailey, sorry to hear about the trouble. We should be able to help, if you can please give a try to the latest version (2.6.1) just released, or simply reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com so that we can better understand the problem you are experiencing. Thank you for your time and take care.

content: Ever since the last update it shows the same hrv score no matter what i do,when i measure or what my heart rate. 7.4_7.7 this range is what i get after update Even if heart rate is 100 or 52 ,morning or evening,after workout or not, sleep or not,after crappy meals or not dont matter anymore. I have samsung A20 and also to get the claim optimal reading i need to turn the heater on hard even before the update this is un açceptable. If you test it only on iphone why sell it on android?Test your app
replyContent: hi Vaba, the range your mention is normal, your HRV is not supposed to oscillate greatly. The range can very well be narrow, then the app learns your range and can provide advice when your body is more stressed with respect to your normal. Feel free to reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com in case of doubts, the app is of course tested on Android

content: I hate this app. It does provide some pertinent data but the app is clunky and I struggle to find my actual HRV measurements. Think about that for a second. I'm struggling to find my HRV measurements on app called HRV4Training! The measurement you can reliably get is a "Recovery Point/Score." What does that mean? Who cares, it's not HRV. Sure, HRV factors into this arbitrary measure but finding the HRV value is not available. Use EliteHRV instead.
replyContent: hi  Alex, thank you for your message. Maybe just a misunderstanding here? Recovery points is exactly your HRV, it is simply a transformation of rMSSD as always reported in scientific literature. Please next time reach out directly to hello@HRV4Training.com so that we can help you out, no subjective or training related factors are part of the score

content: Readings all off
replyContent:
hi there,
Sorry to hear about the trouble. If you can reach out to hello@HRV4Training.com we can most likely help you out, thank you

content: App doesn't have a feature to connect to my heart rate monitor. I have uninstalled but there is no feature for a refund. Please can I get a refund
replyContent:
hi there,
You can connect the app via a heart rate monitor from the Settings menu, in case of trouble please next time simply email us at hello@HRV4Training.com, thank you

content: This measurement app gives a lot of insights in my fitness level and things that influence it. Also the knowledge base on the website with explanations and researches are very interesting and helpfull. I now make sure i don't overtrain too much, something i usually do. But now i can see what the effect is and have been taking it much more easy than usually, resulting in more productive sporting days....but also still much to be learned :-).

Unusable on google pixel 4 unfortunately. There are 4 cameras plus flash, widely spaced, impossible to cover them all and the flash is so hot it really hurt my finger. I checked against my polar 379 and it was way out. Shame as I'm nervous about spending lots on a strap sensor which may fit me poorly.
replyContent:
hi Kiri,
Thank you for your message. Normally just one camera is used as the main camera, so there is no need to cover them all. Feel free to drop us a line at hello@HRV4Training.com and we'll provide more tips, thank you and take care

content: My phone is a Samsung Galaxy note 9 and the application is great, very complete, the appearance is very good too, it has good metrics, anyway, I consider it a 5-star application.
Have used this app on ios for the past while and just switched to android and its the same top class seamless app.

Even with the new update is impossible to get a good reading with the camera and the light. UPDATE. In your documentation you claim this is an iPhone app that was ported to Android, since you are not testing all the versions and models you should specify which ones you test (if any). It doesn't work for OnePlus 6.
replyContent: hi Andres, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. Can you give a try to the latest version (2.6.1) just released, we had positive feedback from other users of the OnePlus 6. Feel free to reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com as well,  this is of course a native Android app - thanks!

content: Impressed by the functionality of this free app thanks for the effort
I used it before and it was great, now just some trouble to import data from oura, but there is a solution thanks. Great to see trends and make better training choices.
replyContent: dear Juan, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. Sometimes there is a delay between the Oura app and Oura cloud, meaning that the data is uploaded to the cloud only later on (and we cannot read it earlier). You can always re-read your data in our app from History though, tap a measurement bar, and then re-read from Oura.

content: This app use to be fantastic and I loved it.
replyContent:
hi Ryley,
Thank you for your time and sorry to hear about the trouble. If you can reach out to us at hello@HRV4Training.com we can try to provide tips for your measurement, the app is running time sensitive operations and therefore often it is sufficient to take a few steps such as closing other apps, or putting the phone in airplane mode.Take care

content: Wasted so many hours on this app. Trying to take a simple 5 minute HRV reading turns in to a massive time suck. You have to stay on the screen, or it will fail. If you get a pop-up notification during reading it will fail. Try another app if your time is valuable. RESPONSE TO DEV: Well the handful of people I know who've tried the app have all complained about the same thing...so "usually no need" seems very narrow minded.
replyContent: Dear Josh, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. If you can take a minute to reach out directly at hello@HRV4Training.com then we can better understand your use case and see what we can do to help. Thank you and take care

content: Seriously man. Can't redo it like 20 times EVERY Morning. Want a refund
replyContent: hi Jaco, please try out the latest version, where we made additional improvements to support more Android phones. Thank you for your time and please next time reach out at hello@HRV4Training.com so that it is easier to help you our. Thank you

content: Been using HRV4TRAINING for 12 months and i find it a great app to track recovery. Syncs well with my TrainingPeaks account too. The guys were also support helpful when i switc3from iPhone to an Android device.

An excellent app that allows you to quickly log a vital measurement during your training phases. Being able to use the phone camera reduces the need for additional faff with a sensor early in the morning and its clear guidance after measurement allows me to make easy decisions about my upcoming training sessions. Sync to TrainingPeaks or Strava for the ultimate benefits of seeing exactly how your previous training went - this gives you many more statistics to inform you.

userName: Carl Nixon Fly Fishing & Fly Tying
content: Failed to Sync with Oura, removed, checked and un checked options for this setting, set the app up 3 times and still failed. Wont allow HRV Measurement from Camera on S10+ either. Option to "measure hrv" doesn't change when reading from Oura or Camera. Requested Refund

I am still testing this app and doing my best to take my morning hrv daily. At first, I have my doubts about the apps claim of the phone's camera to take ppg data accurately. I have done a lot of test along with other apps. Seems pretty okay. Also, this app is really making me curios about vO2 max and threshold lactate that for the first time in my life, I ran for 8km. Of course, this app pushed me to research how runners can run that long . So hope my health will get better because of it.

This is a great app. I found it a few months ago while reading up about HRV measurement and have been using it since. Very easy and intuitive to use, the output seems consistent with what I’ve done in the days prior, how I’ve slept and how much stress I’m under. I’m very impressed how the team was able to get accurate readings through the camera on my phone. Well worth the cost.
Purchased yesterday Home button is off the screen almost. Oura sync button does not work!
replyContent: hi Stuart, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. Would you mind emailing us so that we can help you out in case you are still experiencing issues? Thank you, our contact is hello@HRV4Training.com

content: Works great! Keeps me from overtraining.

Excellent HRV app. Strikes the right balance between complexity and usability to provide valuable feedback. The practice measurement feature with real time ECG/EKG style readout is extremely useful for learning how to get a good reading with your camera. This allows for experimentation with finger position, angle and pressure to find the ideal position for consistent readings. It takes a bit of experimentation and practice but once you figure out exactly where to put your finger on the camera and how hard to press it's extremely accurate and consistent.
Huge effort by owner, i appreciate him. I love his app and website.
I've been using it daily for months and I'm very happy with how easy it is to use. I'm still impressed how it can get HRV data using the camera. As far as I can tell, the information is accurate.

Great HRV and daily fitness metrics recording app. Just wish they'd fix the time zone bug (measurement time off by 1 hour when in Daylight Savings Time in the U.S.). 😉 Also wish it would still let you take a reading when the login server is down, which just happened 2019-12-18 so missed my morning reading. App works fine in Airplane mode so it should let you take a reading when there's server issue. Instead you're stuck at the sign-in page.

Great app as an entry for this interesting topic! What mattered the most for me is that it actually uses the pulse meter of my Samsung Galaxy S7, finally putting it to some use! Love it guys, thanks so much! Cheers!

This app is a must for anyone serious about training and/or anyone who owns an Oura ring. It complements training plans well, and while TrainingPeaks, Strava and other ecosystems are good for quantifying your workout load, HRV4Training allows you to see how your body is coping with the training. I use it daily to validate how things are going and how I am feeling - and this is also where HRV4Training shines, by incorporating subjective feelings and custom tags into your measurements. For Oura ring owners, I think this is indispensable. While I love the hardware, the software is just lacking and with HRV4Training that part is taken care of - you get actionable advice from your measurements, particularly if you're an athlete. You can use custom tags to discover meaningful correlations too. It's an essential quantified self tool, for those into this movement. All in all, I absolutely LOVE HRV4Training and consider it an essential part of my health and training program. I am also a Pro premium user, more than anything to support the developer, who has been extremely responsive to all of my feedback, questions and requests.
Only works accurately on chest strap with Bluetooth and have to have location on for Bluetooth to connect.
Ottima app per una rilevazione della variabilità cardiaca. Servizio assistenza estremamente cortese e disponibile! Prodotto meraviglioso.
Wanted me to open account after I purchased in order to use. It should have mentioned that up front. Any app that wastes my time like that gets one star.
replyContent: thank you for your message Sojourner. I would recommend simply reading the app description, as we do indeed mention it up front. As you can imagine the account is there for you, otherwise you'd lose your data in case you break your phone or simply change it. Maybe next time drop us a line in case of doubts, or read the description. Have a nice day

content: I downloaded this app at the recommendation of a friend and it has been invaluable. I suffer with Chronic Fatigue syndrome and I have been using this app to get a better understanding of my condition day to day and how it responds to different activities. This is helping me to pace myself properly. So yeah. Great app! Also. Great support. I emailed the developers and got a swift response. Overall really impressed!

Currently running 4 hrv apps (two bought, two free). No question, this app is far superior. The most comprehensive yet easy to use. Another benefit, the app with the website is a complete hrv educational course.

I initially had this app on IOS but changed my phone to Android - I contacted the team who gave me a redeemable voucher to download from Google. I'm so glad I made the switch it works so well I'm super pleased as it feels much better than the IOS version.

Well it's hard to say how accurate it is. I have a tickr chest strap which consistently scores lower than the finger sensor. The chest strap score on this app was a close match with elite hrv, so pretty sure the finger sensor is wrong. They can't both be right. Will test for correlation at least because it is easier to do with finger. Any explanations for discrepancy developers?

App molto utile Utilizzo semplice ed immediato. Che si tratti di nuoto, ciclismo, corsa, questa app è utilissima per evitare di andare in overtraining soprattutto, per quanto mi riguarda, nella preparazione dell'Ironman. Bravi!! P.S. un plauso al servizio. Ho cambiato smartphone e subito mi hanno inviato un codice per scaricare l'app sul nuovo dispositivo.
Was reallly good until last update, now when you run thr app, it crashes out without allowing the readings to be uploaded.
Excellent source of information, and history, of my HRV.
Super useful
Very easy to use monitoring tool, which ultimately leads to better training! Bravo.
Very useful for monitoring my training status. Provides great feedback on my training in terms of hrv, resting hr, and recovery.
Great app, very easy to use. Pro version is a small price to pay for key metrics to help any training program.

Brilliant app, give it time to get your data and it can provide very useful insight. The developers are also incredibly friendly and enthusiastic and offer great help and support. I've just paid fkr my pro membership (about £50 for the year) which provides even more depth than on the app) but the app offers a huge amount for just £10. Well worth it if you're a keen sports person and want to see what has various effects on you. Brilliant!
Good App, would be better if non-Strava and TP's users could manually input VO2Max data.
HRV4training is an amazing app!! It helps me determine the right intensity for my workouts and avoid overtraining. Highly recommended!
I bought this to use with my oura ring but it's really buggy and it doesn't work at all for my purposes.
replyContent: hi Julius, sorry to hear about the issues you have experienced with the Oura integration. If you don't mind reaching us at hello@HRV4Training.com, we can try to help you out. Thank you and have a nice day.

content: The developer could have also use the HR and O2 saturation sensor built in on some mobile Phone such as Samsung's 9 and 10 models.
Would be worth the money if it automatically checked for and downloaded data from Oura/3rd party apps
Very buggy. Will use the Camera even with Galaxy selected. Turns on the flash first time but not after that. Unusable...
replyContent: hi there, if you are using the Galaxy mode it is normal that no flash is turned on, as we use only infrared in that case. If you have doubts please reach us at hello@HRV4Training.com and we'll help you out, thank you.

content: Shows promise. I first linked it to my Oura and the data was identical so I didnt see any value. Next I tried a reading with my Samsung S10. Failed to read the 1 minute test. I closed all open apps and put it into airplane mode. Failed to read 1 minute test. Google refund is on a short 15 minute window so although I could have continued to test for solution, the incentive for refund was irresistible. Also, using the phone's camera was above warm. I wouldn't want to try a 5 minute meditation
Great so far!

Overall I don't feel this app is worth the money. After two weeks of use, the HR reading is never "optimal", my recorded daily recorded data is "hidden" with no easy way of finding it. My Strava account info doesn't correlate to the app. The App and desktop site info is unrelated. Navigating menus is cumbersome. As a seasoned 25 year "Rec" athlete I feel more intuitive about my body & training than this App could ever tell me. I gave it 2 stars for the idea and effort only. I uninstalled HRV4.

Been using it for two years, tried multiple other apps/wearables, but this is the one that I stuck with simply because it's so easy to use, which is paramount if you want to use this on a long-term basis (which is when it really starts having its benefits).
Great app and great customer service
Awesome, Marco!! thanks so much for such a complete service!
Reliable (never crashes) and easy to use.

Not sure if my phone is the problem, but it just doesn't work well. Though it would take me a few tries to get a good quality measurement in the beginnings, it wasn't that bad. But then I took some time off training and continued using the app - I noticed that my recovery points were pretty low all the time though I was feeling great. So I decided to give it a break and get back to it later. Now it's not working at all - the measurements give ridiculous results if any at all. What a pity.
Can't measure with camera on my xiaomi pocophone and can't connect to my Bluetooth wrist. Refunded
replyContent: hi Andrei, sorry to hear about the trouble. Please next time simply reach out to us at hello@HRV4Training.com, we can most likely help you out with the camera, note also that no bluetooth wrist sensor apart from the scosche rhythm24 provides accurate data for RR intervals, so most likely not an issue on our end. Have a nice weekend.

content: Now supports Samsung's dedicated sensor. excellent!

I have been using it for 3 months now and it is the best HRV app I have tried. The readings correlate with how I feel and my training loads. I also find the insights very useful. The camera based HR sensor works fine on my Samsung S7 only occasionally having to do it twice.

I bought this app as I'd been interested in HRV for some time and to be more accuarte with my training. Unfortunately I did not find the readings at all helpful. I queried this and received a quick response directing me at a couple of articles to read. Nevertheless I found the readings very unreliable in that how I felt subjectively was more accuarte that the supposed objective reading of the HRV. For example when I was clearly fatigued the HRV did not reflect this or indicate that I should rest. From now on I will ditch the app and continue with a sensible training plan and my subjective feelings, like most athletes.

Well put together app - has given me valuable insights into the main factors affecting my readiness to train. Only request would be for more user configurable fields to more precisely track factors such as sleep, amount of alcohol, training metrics etc..

App is a great training aid and the devs give great support. I'd recommend an high end phone though as the app can take a few tries for an optimal reading at times. May be down to phone updates🤔 Update since the Samsung sensor support. fantastic addition & I find I get an optimal reading first time rather than a few attempts. Only change is my baseline & readings have dropped from around 8.0 to 7.5-7.6. Another + it's less disruptive to my wife's sleep due to no flash light.
replyContent:
hi Carl, 
Sorry to hear about the trouble, as mentioned nothing has changed on our side, hence this might be an issue with your phone. I hope you find a suitable alternative, or you can simply get a sensor (which you have to do if you use another app anyways), as HRV4Training provides a lot more than just the camera measurement. Have a good week.

content: very2 good app that helps me in my training. One suggestion. since the tags like perceive effort and mental energy, it would be nice if the developer can put in an overlay value of the previous day. it would be easier for user to gauge current value more accurately.

Very convenient to use and saves me the cost of another heart rate strap. Before I would take my heart rate strap, apply this gel to it to get a good contact and then take my HRV measurement. Then the ~$60 strap started acting up and would ruin measurements. Def liking the finger measurement.
I don't really like it, after getting a baseline 3 days later I had to do another baseline. NOW I Am waiting for another few days... it's not worth 10$
replyContent: hi Candice! The baseline is always computed using the past week of data, so that you are not stuck with older data that might be less meaningful in the current context. To get a baseline, you always need at least 4 measurements in the past 7 days, try to make it a habit to use the app first thing in the morning, and you'll get useful insights!

content: works until it doesn't. when you try 5 times to get a reading and each time it says, transmission wasn't optimal. very frustrating.
Integration of the Samsung heart rate sensor on my phone makes this my number 1 go-to for HRV. Much more convenient than my heart rate strap (first thing in the morning). :)
Its too advanced for me. It was not what i needed. What i needed was something more like the app Welltory. But i think that to the right people this app might be good.
replyContent: hey Henrique, not sure where the confusion comes from but we certainly compute HRV at the end of the measurement. HRV is not something instantaneous (such as heart rate), so you have to wait 1 minute and your heart rate variability will be computed and shown to you. Please reach out if you have other doubts: hello@HRV4Training.com

content: great app, always integrating new functions

Hey guys, the latest update has changed some of the text on the home screen from white to black when you're in dark mode. This means dark on dark, so you can no longer read the recommendation. Are you able to fix? Otherwise loving the new look! Very tidy. Thanks **Update! This was already fixed, I just needed to install the new version. Thanks!

So far I guess it is ok. I just wonder if my HRV scores are skewed by any inability of the app to pick up ectopic beats and then simply calculate thise as HRV increase? (I am using cam/PPG method. for someone with an arrhytmia ... I am unsure I could ever get a score with an appropriate alpha level?
Great and fast support!!!
So far so good :-)
brilliant. use with a heart rate monitor likr the wahoo tickr for best results
Достачно проста. Богатый функционал.
Amazing backup service Great measurements
Works really well. Using Camera to get reading is so easy, no need for external monitor if you don't have one already. Links to Strava see my activities.

After using this app daily for two years I can confidently say that it works wonderfully and provides actionable data about the sympathetic and parasympathetic states of your nervous system. The app gives you a handy readiness score to help you determine what type of training to engage in that day and to detect wider trends during a certain period of time (e.g. how your training load compares to your HRV reading over time, enabling you to find the optimal training periodization). A wonderful feature of the app is the questionnaire that you will fill out every day. It enables you to make correlations between lifestyle factors and your HRV. A host of other parameters are calculated through the app to help you, among others, determine injury risk and how training and lifestyle factors affect your autonomous nervous system. There is also a host of additional features for coaches and teams. Lastly, the author's website provides fantastic insight and data-driven analyses to encourage you experiment with your own HRV readings and to derive meaningful insights from them.
Fully featured HRV tracking app, with lots of options and reporting. Support are very helpful. No need to buy a chest strap to track HRV!
Pixel XL, could not get a good enough signal.
replyContent: hi Jon, are you still experiencing this issue? Please try to contact us via email and we should be able to help you: hello@HRV4Training.com - take care.

content: Excellent app that makes HRV actionable and meaningful. Prompt and generous reponses and communication with the App Team.

Very easy app to use, and the simplicity of the camera measurement makes it so that you can get more consistent readings, no matter where you are travelling.  Great support service as well if you need the help.

I love this app - very simple to use, and easy to understand the feedback. I take my test everyday, so I can plan what my workouts will be. Also worth checking out the Pro version (there is a trial period) for all the extra info you can get.  My only gripe is that I can't link my Garmin account directly to my HRV4T account, but it can still be done via TrainingPeaks.  Great app - well worth your time if you take your training and recovery seriously.

ive been using HRV4Training daily for over a year now and its done wonders for my training. the daily advice of how hard to train has been irreplaceable. wherever I've had questions or troubles Marco and the team have been very helpful. would thoroughly recommend

Not suitable for Samsung Galaxy S9 camera. I downloaded after being recommended by a friend but I couldn't take a reading even when I lowered the timer to 45 seconds as the LED goes so bright it burns my finger. I don't have the same problem when taking a heart reading on the standard Samsung Health app. If the brightness could be altered slightly to avoid this problem I would definitely download again!
replyContent: hi Dave, we are integrating the Samsung S9 dedicated sensor. If you can reach out via email I am happy to send you a beta to test so that you won't have the camera issue again: hello@HRV4Training.com

content: This app offers an extremely low-friction way to gather your daily HRV readings, as you don't have to use an external device, just the camera on your phone. The data seems to track fairly well with other methods of gathering HRV I'm using. That, coupled along with the extensive write-ups on their blog has me convinced the data is accurate.  My favorite thing though, is the way it correlates data gathered from your daily questionnaire and other health and fitness services to give you a comprehensive overview of how your training affects your general level of stress. Note: These correlations are not available right away, be sure to give it some time to build up sufficient data to unlock  the extra insights before you decide it's not worth it.  Given that the app is affordable and doesn't require (but can use) an external sensor, it is an excellent value. You can pay much more and get less in other places.

I have a Samsung 7 and this app worked great for the last 2 months but now the baseline screen is blank, the current day's reading is blank, I can't scroll backwards thru the history and every time I open the app, it shuts itself down so that I must open it a second time. This has been going on for a few weeks now despite installing again. Am waiting for an update? Update: it was a simple change of the settings that fixed this problem. Thank you!
replyContent: hi Karen, sorry to hear about the trouble. Would you mind emailing us at hello@HRV4Training.com ? We'll try to sort this out for you, thank you.

content: A lot of interesting data.
Good stuff!!! finally managed to install it.
Great app, and great devs !

Just purchased the App.  Was really looking forward to this and it has taken a while to find the site and get the thing loaded.  Too bad it just doesn't work. Can get some pulse traces for about 20% of the time, longer at the start, but less after two or three attempts.  Their contact info doesn't work (not a good sign) and the instructions on how to make the thing work .... not so great.
replyContent: hi Ian, you have messaged us everywhere (facebook, email, here), the contact email is also listed clearly on the website, and finally you have received your refund. Not sure why you felt the need to give us a 1 star at this point, it is obvious that not all Android phones can be supported, we give everyone the refund if requested. Have a good day

content: For people traveling it is a very convenient HRV app as it utilize the phone Camera. Apparently it seems to work. I have not experienced any noticeable unexpected deviation from another app I use parallel at home. I have experienced an impeccable service. For amateur the depth and comprehensive of the information can be perceived as overwhelming, but it give you an opportunity to grow and heightened your knowledge in the HRV field.
I'm wondering how accurate this is. is it normal to have HRV ratings in the 130s?
replyContent:
hi Cade,
Thank you for your message, during our validation we collected data up to 230 ms if you are talking about rMSSD, you can find the paper here: https://www.hrv4training.com/publications.html - maybe next time reach out to customer support instead of giving us a bad review just to ask a question, thank you and have a good day.

content: i like
app is very unstable on my Samsung s9. Will do a ready ok but then crash when viewing history. Has lost a few days readings too. not great. When it works it is good.
womt connect to garmin hmr
replyContent:
hi Eric,
Garmin does not comply to standard protocols, unless you are referring to their chest strap. In this case, it uses ANT, so if you install the required ANT plugin, we will be able to communicate with the sensor. You can link it from Settings / ANT. Have a nice weekend and please next time contact support directly, easier to help that way!

content: Brilliant! and great support. Easily the best return on an app. thanks

Like it a lot but the suggestions, colour legend and desirable range disappeared from the front page two weeks back, so the app on longer gives recommendations after each day's measurement (Galaxy S7 Edge) [Edit 1/2019] Can't use Ant strap with LG G7 One but it is super easy to get an optimal reading with the phone's camera] Would like graphics to be a little more intuitive but working very smoothly. Feature request: ability to change account email.
replyContent: hi Bill, thank you for your message, probably just a glitch. You can solve this easily by going to Menu / Settings and selecting 'Show daily advice', at that point your home screen will be back to normal. Feel free to contact us by email should you have any problem with this, thanks!

content: Easy to use and very enlightening.
Una app muy buena y práctica, además de un servicio técnico espectacularmente rápido y efectivo

The app helps me avoid overtraining. The HRV values measured by the app usually coincide with my subjective feeling of exhaustion. The measurements are an additional inducement to take a break and start the next training fully recovered.
Superb analysis to determine your body's adaptation to training and improvement over time, and readiness to perform on a daily basis. All backed by top notch science and great explanation. Top marks.

Very useful app. Still investigating all the functions but feel this is the most trustworthy and user-friendly of these types of app. The fact it doesn't require a heart rate monitor or some other costly piece of equipment makes it both more convenient and accessible.
Simply does not work with a Samsung S8. 10 tries and no success. What a pity...
replyContent: hi there, the app should work fine with your phone. If you can email us, we'll try to help you out in obtaining optimal quality while using the camera, thanks!

content: Amazing app! Completely revolutionary for guiding training!
App utilissima e ben fatta. Servizio assistenza eccezionale. Grazie Marco per avermi risolto il piccolo problema

Very useful basic concept well implemented (optical HRV), HOWEVER with promising extras let down by significant inconsistencies and problems lurking, some of which seem hazardous. Most recently I realise data import from Strava for some dates seems to repeated and occasionally lossy, so the training load analysis chart is unstable, and changes dramatically if I go back and re-import data for specific dates. It is as if some code path pulls from Strava but ignores certain activities. HRV trends commentary currently seems inconsistent with respect to some graphs (eg my training load appears to be increasing week over week, but always shows as "decreasing") or at least not documented. The new lactate threshold feature looks interesting but there is no simple explanation of what each of the three different figures mean, only a link to a long blog post. Dropbox export appears to be failing without explanation. Technical support appears prompt and usually acknowledges issues although not always resolving these in a timely way.
Get a set of game dice for less and just roll them for random results instead of wasting money on this app!
Would that app be compatible with my new OnePlus6?
Very useful app,
I love this app, I find that most of the time it's in tune with how I feel. Thanks for making it for android devices😘
Fantastic app. Save your money having to buy a dedicated device. The reading is easy - just lay the phone down on a hard surface and you'll get a perfect measure.
much money for nothing. import from strava, tp not working. not enough data for hrv. elitehrv much better and free, and lastly l can not login properly. dont buy this app and save yor money.
replyContent: hi Ugur, sorry to hear about the trouble. Would you mind emailing us (hello@HRV4Training.com) so that we can help you linking the app, all integrations certainly work. Not sure also what you mean with not enough data? Some historical data is required to provide advice, as it's all based on relative changes from your own baseline. Have a nice day

content: Very good app for monitoring your hrv backed up with useful insights and great customer service.

This is a great app for when you train more and are concerned about over training. I've used this app for about 7 months and have avoided at least one over training condition by monitoring the HRV and HR with this app. It is easy to use and provides some interesting insight and correlations when used together with Strava or TrainingPeaks.

This is great hrv app. I like the fact that you can use the phone's camera. It is scientifically studied according to the research. Overall this is a excellent investment for your training. Highly recommend and well worth the money.
Definitely a great app to have and great support from the team as well very impressive would recommend 100%!!!
It would take sometimes up to 6 tries to get an 'optimal' reading
replyContent: Sorry to hear about the trouble. Please double check this list: https://bit.ly/2BacAsb and also make sure there are no other operations in the background when measuring as our processing is quite time critical. Often putting the phone in airplane mode can help - notifications for example should certainly be avoided :) Hope this helps!

content: I take Calcium Channel Blockers and later found that the HRV measurements will not be "accurate" or at least helpful if you are on a medication like this. So in the end, until I get off of them, using the app isn't something that is an option for me. I do wish they mentioned this as a "disclaimer", but honestly, it isn't a big deal and I am not completely sure of the science behind it to know whether they should have even done that anyway. Nevertheless, if you are on these medications, be advised.  However, as soon as I AM off of them, I will be right back here. The app is fantastic and the data over time looks to be very robust. Very usable.   And customer service was spectacular with the refund. No problems at all.

Unable to track multiple HRV sessions in one day, which is a complete deal 
breaker, yet such a simple feature to incorporate. A real shame because the 
app looks beautiful. Fix that and I'm all for this app.
replyContent: hi Jack! Thank you for your feedback. We try to enforce the single morning measurement so that HRV data can be properly contextualized which is key for interpretation. Unfortunately there is much confusion on how to use these data properly and we think this is the ideal condition. Please email us if interested in getting also Camera HRV for free!

content: Does what it says it does. Does it really well. Incredible app.

this app is becoming better and better. Very useful and intuitive. I am 
loving it.
replyContent: hi Jose! Sorry to hear about the trouble with the estimate. When we analyze VO2max, we look only at the past few weeks, to make sure the estimate is realistic and represents your current condition. This might be the reason why you have many activities, maybe a little older, and no estimate. Please let us know via email if you have issues, thanks!

content:
The real deal. It goes way beyond my comprehension in some areas, but if I 
understood the indepth stuff I'd likely still give it a 5 star. The team 
are SUPER friendly too!
Does not work with huawei P20 pro
replyContent: hi Edward, the P20 Pro is supported by the latest version of HRV4Training. Enjoy.

content: Very useful.

It worked in practice mode twice and now will not work at all. What is up? 
I'd like a refund.
replyContent: Dear Susan, thank you for your message and sorry to hear about the trouble. Most likely, you simply need to make sure there are no other heavy operations in the background (downloading other apps, etc.) while using the camera based measurement, as it is very time sensitive. Please email us and we'll provide tips to help you out, thanks!

content: Every morning I do my HRV and compare it with my mental & physical assessment for the day. I am recovering from 1 1/2 years of debilitating Lyme Disease with Co-Infections and retroviruses. I now have a tool to use before I crash and am bedridden again. If my HRV falls below 8, I know that it's a rest day for me. 8.4 to 8.6 is my happy place. Thanks for developing this free app and sharing it. I am grateful.

Helps you understand your bodies recovery to stressors and to optimise 
training.

Adjusting the review to 4 stars since I stopped experiencing any new crashes in the past few days. Still need to get acquainted with the UI and for those who are new, you have to be consistent and patient with your measurements. Didn't try to measure with the camera. I would've liked to have a trial version first for few days since it took me a while to decide to buy it. I will provide a more comprehensive review later
replyContent: hi Alexandru, sorry to hear about the crashes. If you can email us with more details, we might be able to address them and help you out in case of issues. Thank you.

content: Not worth getting for free. Commonly got wildly different readings when taking two readings in a row. First got a 3 and on repeat a 9. After using it for several days could no longer log in. Not ready for prime time, at least on  Note 8.
replyContent: hi Ben, sorry to hear about the trouble experienced with the app. We might be able to help you out in achieving better consistency with your readings, please next time reach out via email and we'll provide all the required support, these are time critical operations and might require a few adjustments. Thanks!

content: Great app. Gives a good indication of how to train and tracks you fitness through your training journey.
Just installed this and I've found it easy to use, works unexpectedly well, lots of useful information, well documented, great user experience! Highly recommended.
Very helpful insights and extremely intriguing science. Even if you are not training, I think the data is cool and interesting for anyone interested in physiology.

A very comprehensive app which includes lots of measurements which can be exported.  What is really useful though is comparing measurements over time.  Do take your measurements at the same time, in the same position every day, to get useful data.  My health is poor and I have been using this app to help manage my activity levels.  HRV doesn't lie!  Quick responses to support questions.  The most I've ever spent on an app, but worth it.
Need refund please doesn't work with my phone
Hrv4training is reliable and gets updated very often with many new features. Highly recommended even for non athletes.
Helps in setting training  levels to prevent over training. Insights are really useful seeing where you are in your training.
Great app with an amazing support.

I like and stand behind the science of HRV.  However it is very clear that this app is more novelty than legitimate measurement. It was clear when I swapped to a new phone that my scores immediately jumped higher on average overall. Okay I can deal with that.  However, I can take the same measurements 3x from the same seated position within an hour of each other and it has ranged from 8.0 all the way to 10.6!  By this very fact how are you to know which is legitimate measurement? The answer is you don't- there is nothing that this helps you with.
replyContent: hi Matthew, please try to understand what you are measuring, as it is nonsense to measure with an hour gap and expect the same result. Your physiology is always changing and affected by many external factors, which is why it is key to measure as soon as you wake up (context!). This might help: https://goo.gl/QUxnJb - next time just ask please :)

content: Doesn't work on Kogan phones
its been great so far and super easy to use! last but not least great costumer service, needed help and got reply in less than an hour!
Easy to learn and use. Does what it promises.

Works well with strap.  Camera works, but I've found strap to be far more accurate.  Camera data is directional, not absolute.  Also a bit pricey, but there is  tons of useful information and analysis available.  Only records/tracks one reading per day.
Awesome.  Simple to use great information!
replyContent: thank you!

content: Great app when used correctly and with a HR strap.  I found the camera readings on my phone - Nexus 6P and now the Pixel 2 XL - to be less reliable.  Your results may be better than mine.  Overall, I love the app and it's integration with trainingpeaks.

This is an incredibly useful app,for those interested in measuring and monitoring health biomarkers. Whether you're interested in optimising your physical training schedule, or better understanding your body's unique responses to stress so that you can improve resilience - tracking HRV is crucial. Thanks to the rapid progress of technology, this app allows you to do just that. It also includes a ton of bonus features, such as comparing your HRV to the wider population and connecting to external measuring devices. All in all it's well worth the money, for those serious about health. The developers are also incredibly knowledgeable and write an fantastic blog!

For camera based HRV, or if you are a runner, this is really the only choice, for everyone else is just the best one. For lifters, an additional bonus is the acute vs chronic load analysis, even though it has nothing to do with HR. All science, no bs.
Can this app use the dedicated hr monitor on my galaxy s7? Cuz it doesn't seem like it..
Well crafted app. Accurate measurement with phone camera. Great analyses

After a few weeks, my experience has been that my recovery score is very sensitive to when/how I take my measurement. It seems consistent if my measurement is take immediately upon awakening in the same position (e.g laying on my back with phone resting in my chest). If I need to get up to use the bathroom or help my children before I take the measurement, my recovery score will be significantly decreased (from a very good score to a very poor score). Even sitting up in bed seems to make the score noticeably worse.   My feeling is that this app has potential but is impractical for my own current lifestyle.
replyContent: hi Jay, thank you for your message. Consistency is key for HRV measurements, as the specific routine and body position do have an influence. You do not necessarily need to take the measurement lying down in bed, for example doing it while sitting in the bathroom is fine, but try to pick one routine and follow it as much as possible. Hope this helps

content: As a novice runner I find this app extremely helpful especially when determining when I should take a rest/recovery day. When I migrated to a newer phone the author of the app was amazingly fast troubleshooting my difficulties synching.
Hello, please refund. Sorry, this app is useless for me.
replyContent: hi Juris, please email us if you have problems, there is no point writing a review like this one and insulting our work. If you reach out via email, we'll do our best to help you out in making use of the app or get you a refund. Thanks.

content: Best HRV app there is, easy to measure via phone camera, very accurate readings. Tells you when to limit workout intensity etc. I am best shape of my life, thanks to this great app.
replyContent: Thank you so much, really glad to hear!

content: I really love that the app can measure HRV accurately using the camera without the need to put on the chest strap. One thing I find hard is to decide how to set the subjective measurements. Most often I leave them untouched in the middle.
fantastic.only/need/camera/lens/to/measure/hrv/and/you/get/the/same metrics/and/time/series/as/more/expensive/apps/that/require/external monitors.
Well worth the price.

Best HRV app, and I've tried them all. Uses your phone camera to capture HRV. No more waking up and putting on a chest strap. Bluetooth and ANT+ optional if you just love your chest strap though. Only downside: saves only one reading per day.

The important thing for me is to be able to consistently test/monitor.  The fact that this takes very accurate readings without strapping on my chest strap is important in that the convenience keeps me consistently measuring every morning.  Even beyond this, the developer of this app seems to be a great data scientist who somehow finds time to personally support the product.  Thanks Marco!
replyContent: Thanks a lot Gary!

content: This seems a very comprehensive guide to training. I am only just getting started with it but with its Strava integration and HRV analysis I'm expecting a very good overview of my readiness to train and compete. Also worth mentioning that Marco is very attentive to his users. Excellent support and the app keeps getting better.
replyContent: Thanks Dominic!

content: Most reliable training advices I have found among all the hrv monitors I tried
replyContent: Thank you Nicola!

content: So far really liking the features.  Can't link to Strava though. I'm getting a not allowed error message from Google. This is a pretty big detriment.    Edit: I did find a workaround which is to login to Strava with my email and password login - not google login. The Google login is what causes the error.
replyContent: hi there! I think we have a fix for this, can you please email us? Thanks!

content: Great app. solid foundation, consistent readings and tons of research.  i have been using this app as my companion to cycling plan, so far it has assisted me greatly in knowing when to back off and take a day off or reduce intensity.  Consequently i have avoided sickness and achieved PR's.  The R&D team is active and the app is constantly upgraded. After a power meter and my Wahoo Kickr i consider this the next best investment - the money is well worth it.  i recommend this app to any athlete who is serious about managing their training in the context of stressful lives and family commitments.
replyContent: thanks a lot Waldek!

content: I want a refund. The apps cant sync with my Forerunner 35 bluetooth sensors and it can also read HR from my camera. Pls i just want my refund.

content: Found this really useful despite not being a serious althlete

content: It's been a pivotal part of my rugby​training this last season. As the season went on things got harder and I was able to push myself knowing when I had fully recovered.
replyContent: thank you so much Joe, really great to hear you found the data useful for your training. All the best for the next season!

content: Great app, kept up to date with latest HRV research by a leading researcher in the field.

Some Android phones unfortunately get a bit hot, if the 45 seconds measurement is also problematic, the only way to solve the problem would be to use a chest strap. content: Unfortunately, not compatible with my Android phone.
Great app! Just wish I could have the coach version for my android phone....
Wondering about how to get rid of duplicate rides that were uploaded accidentally? Just starting, would like to clear my database and start over.
replyContent: hi Sarah! Can you please email us in case you still have trouble? In any case, you can edit your Tags from the History page, by tapping a bar. Note that when you edit a day, you are editing training-related tags for the day before.

content: Won't work on Mate 9

If you are experiencing issues with the camera measurement, we state clearly not all phones can be supported or tested and that you can get a refund quickly. content: Unable to measure hrv with my phone. I tried under the practice mode and it works, but when I try to measure in the app my hrv, it shows up an error message saying that there are a delay in processing the information resulting in inaccurate data, try to kill all the app on your phone and try again. I'm quite disappointed because I pay 10 Euro for this..
replyContent: hi Fabio, sorry to hear about the issues you've been experiencing with the camera measurement. Odd that it goes through with the practice mode but not with the actual measurement, as they are the exact same. Could you try to terminate the app (and maybe also others that might be working in the background) and give this another shot? Thanks.

content: I don't generally pay for apps, but this one is worth the money. Not only does it provide a lot of useful information, but they actually publish the science behind it. The only thing I've noticed is that it doesn't read HR data or estimate vo2max from training peaks; it's not a huge problem though since I could just go back to syncing with strava.
replyContent: thanks a lot Philip! On the TP sync: heart rate data, elevation gain and TSS can be read only for premium accounts (while activity type, distance and duration for all accounts), hence Strava is a better option if you do not have a premium TP, but you figured that out already :)

content: With respect to taking measurements the app seems to work fine. It's harder to get good readings than you'd expect but that is a function of the technique and this app handles the measuring process much better than other apps. Where this app is poor is in helping you interpret the data. On each screen you are shown some numbers but there is no meaningful description of what you're looking at. "You got 8.4 recovery points". Ok?? Out of 10? 100? What am I supposed to do with that? Call 911? Run a second marathon? What even went into that analysis? Reading through the website is helpful but the app does a poor job connecting the concepts back to even that. My impression is that the app has good potential but the user experience has quite a ways to go.
replyContent: hi Greg, thank you for your feedback, sorry to hear you are not having a good experience. Indeed we try to cover most aspects on the blog, and please feel free to reach out via email should you need additional help. The app will provide better guidance as you accumulate data, typically a few days are sufficient.

content: Best hrv app I've used to date.

Camera function didn't work on my Droid Turbo, so followed app's advice and purchased Polar H7 HR strap. Now HRV4 training can't pair with it and shuts down. (The HR strap works well with Polar's app). HRV4  promises great functionality, but so far none of it works for me.  Update: after some friendly correspondence with developers leaving GPS on has allowed app to pair consistently.  Integrates much, but not all (TSS would be good), Training Peaks data for me.  Will take a few weeks to make use of trends.
replyContent: hi Andrew, sorry to hear about the trouble you've had with the app. Would you mind emailing us with more details on the issues you had with the Polar sensor? If you go to Settings in the app, and select Bluetooth, then tap Scan, is the app able to find your sensor? Thanks

content: So far, so good! replyContent: Thank you Edvardas! Sorry to hear about the odd glitch with location services, glad you sorted it out :)

content: Appears to work very well. I would like the ability to record other daily datasets. A single reading in the morning is not enough.
This is the definitive app for HRV tracking. The developers are very helpful and their website explaining the science behind it helps our clients get the most out of using this fantastic app!
replyContent: Thank you Jason!

content: Simple and intuitive to use + backed by numerous scientific papers. This App is really great.  I love that I don't need any additional accessories. content: My favorite app 😂
